derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English (denoting realgar): from Latin sandaraca, from Greek sandarakē, of Asiatic origin. The current sense dates from the mid 17th cent

means.word_mean: 1. durable fragrant wood; used in building (as in the roof of the cathedral at Cordova, Spain)
2. a brittle and faintly aromatic translucent resin used in varnishes
3. large coniferous evergreen tree of North Africa and Spain having flattened branches and scalelike leaves yielding a hard fragrant wood; bark yields a resin used in varnishes
